note.p: Career: Worked in the National Bank of Scotland; took up medicine; Professor of Natural History, Free Church College, Edinburgh; Curator of the Imperial Museum of India (1864); Professor of Comparative Anatomy, Medical College, Calcutta (by 1877); went on scientific expeditions to Burmah and the Mergui archipelago; resigned (1886)
Memberships: FRSE; FLS; Member of the Asiatic Society of Bengal; Fellow of the Senate of the Calcutta University
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 113-116 signed by G A B
References: R V Jones, 'The "Plain Story" of James Watt: the Wilkins Lecture 1969' in NR 1969 vol 24 pp 194-220
